DOC.brief_summary: The purpose project explore interaction caffeine dipyridamole ischemia-reperfusion injury forearm .
DOC.brief_title: Does Caffeine Reduce Dipyridamole-Induced Protection Against Ischemia-Reperfusion Injury ?
DOC.detailed_description: Dipyridamole proven reduce target Annexin A5 responses ischemic exercise , indicate protection ischemia-reperfusion injury human ( pharmacological preconditioning ) . Dipyridamole increase endogenous adenosine level inhibition nucleoside transporter ( ENT-1 ) . Activation adenosine receptor protect ischemia-reperfusion injury . We hypothesize endogenous adenosine mediates protective effect dipyridamole ischemia-reperfusion injury . Therefore adenosine receptor antagonist caffeine reduce benefit dipyridamole forearm ischemia-reperfusion injury .
DOC.criteria: Male Age 1850yr . cardiovascular disease hypertension ( systole > 140 mmHg , diastole > 90 mmHg ) hypercholesterolemia ( random total cholesterol > 6.5 mmol/l ) diabetes mellitus ( fast glucose > 7.0 mmol/L random glucose > 11.0 mmol/L ) asthma ( recurrent episode dyspnea wheezing , usage prescribe inhalation medication : i.e . corticosteroid B2agonists ) participation clinical trial last 60 day prior study . administration two dos Annexin A5 ( 0,1mg ; 450MBq ) last 5 year prior study .
